EY Parthenon - Value Creation helps PE firms, their portfolio companies, and corporate companies realize better returns by unlocking value and accelerating time to money through targeted operational improvements. You will work on projects that span the entire lifecycle of a transaction, including operational due diligence where we focus on EBITDA upside and operational risk; buy side carve out and integration planning to ensure a newly spun out business can operate by itself and potentially merge to quickly realize anticipated synergies; post-acquisition 100 day and value creation planning; ongoing performance improvement; and exit readiness planning to inform an optimal strategy for maximizing returns and ensuring the buyer is well positioned to continue to enhance value.

* Strategy and operations management consulting experience.
* Excellent analytical, problem solving/modeling skills, and the confidence to translate complex data into meaningful insights.
* Experience in operational due diligence, operational transformation, and performance improvement.
* Experience in business integrations, divestitures, and/or carve-outs with a demonstrated aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis.

* Experience leading and managing cross-functional teams in complex business environments.
* The ability to prioritize effectively on projects and the skills to adapt quickly to new challenges and concepts.
* Excellent negotiation and influencing skills, and the ability to develop long-lasting relationships both internally and externally.

* A proven record of excellence in M&A transactions.

* Experience gained within another large professional services organization.
* MBA is preferred.
* Dynamic individuals who thrive in ambiguous situations to help clients solve their most critical strategic, business, and economic challenges.

We’re interested in talented professionals with the ability to visualize our clients’ goals and think creatively to facilitate them. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, and a genuine passion for taking on new challenges, this role is for you.

  

**What we offer**

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Join us in our team-led and leader-enabled hybrid model. Audiovisual (AV) technicians set up and run the sound, lighting, video equipment used to conduct live events such as meetings, sports games, business conventions, and concerts. AV technicians skillfully run video, audio, and signal testing. Their responsibility is to guarantee their clients a high-quality experience. Technicians ensure all connected systems operate at peak performance. When issues arise, they troubleshoot and adjust the AV system as required. AV technicians use objective analysis to spot issues and eliminate them before an event.

* Operate and Troubleshoot Sound and Video

A key duty of AV technicians is to execute a flawless event from a media standpoint. The most successful technicians problem-solve and handle equipment malfunctions well, even under pressure. They focus on making sure their systems are working properly. When something goes wrong, AV technicians troubleshoot without showing concern to customers.

AV technicians are enthusiastic individuals who can follow instructions and work well with a team while installing video, lighting, and audio systems.

title: Legal Talent Acquisition Coordinator
description:
**Job Description**  

Crowell & Moring LLP is an international law firm with offices in the United States, Europe, MENA, and Asia that represents clients in litigation and arbitration, regulatory and policy, intellectual property, and transactional and corporate matters. The firm is internationally recognized for its representation of Fortune 500 companies in high-stakes litigation and government-facing matters, as well as its ongoing commitment to pro bono service and diversity, equity, and inclusion.


The Legal Talent Acquisition Coordinator will be responsible for the administrative coordination and implementation of law student recruitment, judicial clerkship recruitment, lateral associate/counsel/professional track attorney recruitment, the summer associate program, and onboarding processes. The position will be located in our New York, NY or Washington, DC office.

**Job Description & Responsibilities**

***Recruitment***

* Posts job descriptions on internal and external recruitment sites.
* Processes candidate applications, updates candidate tracking database, updates data reports, and maintains complete candidate files and applicant tracking database.
* Manages the search firm fee agreements process, including execution, tracking and ensuring compliance with departmental standards.
* Coordinates the registration process for recruitment with law schools across the U.S. Completes sign-up forms and required candidate data requests, and manage date assignments.
* Schedules candidate interviews and works with Legal Talent Acquisition team members to ensure seamless candidate experience and interview process.
* Arranges logistics for candidate interviews, including scheduling conference room reservations, technology setup for virtual interviews as needed, and greeting candidates upon arrival.
* Prepares and distributes interview materials, including schedules, candidate application materials and interview guides, and solicits evaluations from attorney interviewers.
* Makes reservations and arrangements for supplemental recruitment activities and follow-up events, including meetings, lunches/dinners, and receptions.
* Prepares candidate materials and packets for review and offer consideration by Recruitment Committee.
* Prepares correspondence including interview confirmation details, offer letters, candidate status updates, rejections, and internal communications regarding candidate status.
* Maintains candidate recruitment files.

***Summer Associate Program***

* Works with the firm-wide Legal Talent Acquisition team to coordinate all aspects of the summer associate program, including planning, preparation, internal and external communications, orientation, social events, work allocation and evaluations, learning & development programs, summer associate committee meetings, and final offer decision process.
* Serves as a primary point of contact for the summer associates and firm personnel throughout the summer program in the Washington, DC and New York, NY offices.
* Acts as an advisor to the Manager of Legal Talent Acquisition and Summer Associate Chair Partners in Washington, DC and New York, NY to trouble-shoot issues, identify opportunities for growth and ensure compliance with program process and procedures.

***On-Boarding***

* Coordinates conflicts and background check processes.
* Manages data entry within the onboarding system to ensure all new hire information is accurately processed prior to new hire arrival
* Facilitates pre-arrival and post-arrival onboarding processes for Summer Associate, Associate, and Counsel new hires, including coordinating orientation schedules, ensuring all necessary documentation is completed and processing I-9 paperwork through online onboarding system to ensure compliance.
* Organizes orientation schedules for Summer Associate, Law Clerk, Associate, and Counsel new hires.
* Orders and coordinates welcome packages for new hires.
* Processes payment of stipends and advances for entry-level associates.

***Candidate Engagement and Sourcing***

* Assists in developing talent pipelines, alternative strategic recruitment methods and firm-wide processes and procedures to effectively and efficiently fill positions with top-rate talent.
* Coordinates outreach events and programs for law students and judicial clerks in partnership with Legal Talent Acquisition team members, firm affinity groups, practice groups, law schools and student groups, and other internal and external stakeholders.

Responsible for the daily operations of the restaurant, including staff scheduling, delegating tasks, supervising service and strong floor presence.

Explore a career with **Mercy Hospital**, a 375-bed not-for-profit hospital and member of Catholic Health, which was voted a Top Workplace on Long Island for two consecutive year by *Newsday*. Mercy offers a NYS designated Stroke Center, Breast Imaging Center of Excellence, Level III Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, and has received Pathway to Excellence designation from the American Nurses Credentialing Center - the only hospital in the region and one of only two in NY State to receive this prestigious award.
Job Details:

Requirements include:* NYS RN License
* BLS required
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and exercise good critical thinking skills; Previous experience in a rehab setting a plus!
* Certifications/BSN preferred


Posted Salary Range: USD $49.65 - USD $68.10 /Hr. :

This range serves as a good faith estimate and actual pay will encompass a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience. The salary range or rate listed does not include any bonuses/incentive, differential pay or other forms of compensation that may be applicable to this job and it does not include the value of benefits.  

At Catholic Health, we believe in a people-first approach. In addition to the estimated base pay provided, Catholic Health offers generous benefits packages, generous tuition assistance, a defined benefit pension plan, and a culture that supports professional and educational growth.
